data.data:
The Go runtime's garbage collector will detect and discard unreachable __channels__.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
The Go runtime's garbage collector will detect and discard __goroutines__ that will not be used again.

{{False||True}}

data.name: Input
data.data: When an application's `main` function terminates, all child __goroutines__ {{are killed||continue until they return}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Setting a channel's value to {{nil}} will disable it's case in a __select__ statement.

data.name: Input
data.data: Declaring a `sync.Once` instance inside of a function is usually the {{wrong||right}} thing to do.

data.name: Input
data.data: By convention, functions receiving a `context.Context` declare it as the {{first||last|only}} parameter.

data.name: Input
data.data: A listing of Go's standard library packages can be found at https://{{pkg.go.dev/std}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
Documentation for standard library package `io` can be found at https://{{pkg.go.dev/io}}.

(... and similarly for all packages in the std lib)

data.name: Input
data.data: When a `context.Context` is cancelled, child contexts created from it via `WithCancel`, `WithTimeout` or `WithDeadline` {{are cancelled||continue independently}}.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data:
`a` is a {{slice||array|(compiler error!)}}.

```
a := []int{1, 2, 3}
```

data.name: Input
data.data:
`a` is a {{array||slice|(compiler error!)}}.

```
a := [...]int{1, 2, 3}
```

data.name: Input
data.data:
Go short-circuits its boolean expressions: ie, `bar()` is never called below.

```
foo := false && bar()
baz := true || bar()
```

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
Input
data.data:
```
names := [4]string{"Alice", "Bob", "Carol", "Dave"}
var slc []string = names[1:3]
slc[0] = "Bill"
fmt.Println(names[1])
```

This program prints: {{Bill||Bob}}

data.name: Input
data.data: The zero value of a slice is {{nil}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
a := make([]int, 4, 10)
```
`a` has length {{4}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
a := make([]int, 4, 10)
```
The capacity of `a` is {{10}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
a := make([]int, 4)
```
The capacity of `a` is {{4}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Raw string literals are enclosed in {{backquotes||double quotes|single quotes|curlies|angle brackets}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Interpreted string literals are enclosed in {{double quotes||backquotes|single quotes|curlies|angle brackets}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Rune literals are enclosed in {{single quotes||double quotes|backquotes|curlies|angle brackets}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
a := 'f'
```
`a` is a {{rune||string}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
a := "f"
```
`a` is a {{string||rune}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
a := `f`
```
`a` is a {{string||rune}}.

Input
Input
Input
Input
Input

data.data: A __binary__ integer literal must begin with {{ either of these || `0b` | `0B` }}

data.name: Input
data.data: A __hexadecimal__ integer literal must begin with {{ either `0x` or `0X` || `0x` | `0X` }}.

data.name: Input
data.data: An __octal__ integer literal must begin with {{ either `0`, `0o`, or `0O` || `0o` | `0O` | `0` }}

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
func main() {
	var a int = 010
	fmt.Println(a)
}
```

The above program prints {{ `8` || `010` | `10` }} to the console.

data.data:
```
var f float = 3.9
var i int = int(f)
```
The value of `i` is {{3}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
var f float = -1.75
var i int = int(f)
```
The value of `i` is {{-1}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```
for i, v := range x { // <- this one
  doThings(i, v)
}  // <- and this one
```

The curly braces `{}` surrounding a loop's execution block are {{required||optional}}.

Input

data.name: Input
data.data: Arrays in golang have {{fixed||dynamic}} size.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```golang
arr := [6]string{"this", "is", "an", "array", "of", "strings"}
var slc []string = arr[1:4]
```
The length of `slc` is {{3}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
```golang
arr := [6]string{"this", "is", "an", "array", "of", "strings"}
var slc []string = arr[1:4]
```

The first element of `slc` is {{is}}.

(omit quotation marks)

data.name: Input
data.data:
```golang
arr := [6]string{"this", "is", "an", "array", "of", "strings"}
var slc []string = arr[1:4]
```

The last element of `slc` is {{array}}.

(omit quotation marks)

data.data: Names are exported if they start with a {{capital letter}}.

Input
Input

data.data: A `range` loop over a slice references the {{index, value||value, index}} of the slice's items in each loop iteration.

data.name: Input
data.data: A {{closure}} is a function value that references variables from outside its body.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data: Interfaces can be declared {{in any block||only in the package level block|only in a function or method block}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: By convention, interface names **often** end with {{er}}.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data:
Methods can be defined on types imported from another package.

{{False||True}}

data.name: Input
data.data: Methods with {{pointer||value}} receivers are able to alter the receiver from the perspective of the calling code.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data: By convention, an `error` returned from a function is the {{last||first|only}} return parameter.

data.name: Input
data.data: A {{goroutine}} is a lightweight thread-like thing managed by the Go runtime.

data.name: Input
data.data: A goroutine's stack size {{self-adjusts dynamically as required||needs to be managed by the parent routine}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: By convention, a go module name should be {{kebab-cased||snake_cased|camelCased|SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASED|PascalCased}}.

data.name: Input
Input
Input
Input
Input
data.data:
Which is preferred?

```
capitalized :=    errors.New("Something went wrong with foo")
notCapitalized := errors.New("something went wrong with foo")
```

{{notCapitalized||capitalized}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
Go {{does not allow||allows}} circular dependencies between packages.

```
package a

import "b"

...
```

```
package b

import "a"

...
```

data.name: Input
data.data: To view the **godocs** for the package `example`, run: {{go doc example}}.

data.name: Input
Input
Input
data.data: If a package is named {{internal}}, its exported members are visible only to its parent package and the descendants of that parent package.

data.name: Input
data.data:
Go has a **ternary operator**.

```go
someBool := false
x := someBool ? 4 : 2 // x is now 2
```

{{False||True}}

data.name: Input
data.data: Zero-parameter, zero-return functions named {{init}} are automatically run at the first invocation of their containing package.

data.name: Input
data.data: A given package can have {{any number of||1|2|3}} `func init() {...}` function(s).

data.name: Input
data.data: A given file can have {{any number of||1|2|3}} `func init() {...}` function(s).

data.name: Input
data.data: `someDirectory/a.go` and `someDirectory/b.go`, adjacent Go source files, {{must||should|may|should not|must not}} belong to the same package.

data.name: Input
data.data:
Error messages {{should not||should}} include punctuation.

```go
// punctuation
e1 := errors.New("there was an error.")
// no punctuation
e2 := errors.New("there was an error")
```

data.name: Input
data.data: A {{package}} is a collection of source files in the same directory that are compiled together.

data.name: Input
data.data: A {{module}} is a collection of related Go packages that are released together.

data.name: Input
data.data: An executable Go module must contain a package named {{main}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
A module's `go.mod` file should be tracked by the version control system.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
A module's `go.sum` file should be tracked by the version control system.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
It is possible & practical for a go program to launch __1000s__ of __goroutines__.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
Any go function can be launched as a __goroutine__.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data: A __goroutine__ is launched by placing the keyword {{go}} before a function call.

data.name: Input
data.data:
Types from imported packages can be aliased:

```go
package main

import "fmt"

type myFormatter = fmt.Formatter
```

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
It is possible to alias types defined in external `modules`:

```go
package main

import "github.com/some-external/pgk"

type myType = pgk.someType
```

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data: The {{<-}} operator is used to read from or write to a __channel__.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data: It is {{rare||mandatory|impossible|common}} for a __goroutine__ to both read from and write to a given __channel__.

data.name: Input
data.data: A value written to a __channel__ can be read {{only once, by the first||by each}} __goroutine__ that reads from the channel.

data.name: Input
data.data: The zero-value of a __channel__ is {{nil}}.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data: The __godoc__ for public go module (eg, from github or similar) is automatically published to the site https://{{pkg.go.dev}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: A {{chan}} is go's built-in type for communication between goroutines.

data.name: Input
data.data: __channels__ are {{pointer||value}} types.

data.name: Input
data.data: A channel `ch` is closed with the statement {{close(ch)}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Reading from a __closed__ channel {{returns the zero-value of the channel's type||blocks forever|panics}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Attempting to read a value from a __channel__ succeeds {{unconditionally||only if the channel has an available value|if the channel is open}}.

data.name: Input
data.data: Writing to a __closed channel__ {{causes a panic||blocks indefinitely|fails silently}}.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data: A __select__ statement with multiple cases ready to proceed {{chooses one randomly||executes in order}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
Each case in a __select__ statement creates its own block scope.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
Every __case__ in a __select__ statement is a read or a write to a channel.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data: If every __goroutine__ in a Go application is deadlocked, the program {{is halted by the Go runtime||hangs forever}}.

data.name: Input
data.data:
The `main` function of a Go application runs in a __goroutine__.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
__select__ statements may have a `default:` clause.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data: In practice, it is {{uncommon||common}} for a __select__ statement to contain a `default:` clause.

data.name: Input
data.data: When declaring an empty slice, {{ `var t[]string` || `t := []string{}` }} is preferred.

data.name: Input
data.data:
`nil` is a keyword in Go.

{{ False || True }}

data.name: Input
data.data:
`panic()` should be used for normal error handling.

{{ False || True }}

data.name: Input
data.data: Standard library imports should be the {{ first || last | (no opinion) }} imports listed in a package.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data: Prefer {{ `userID` || `userId` }} as an identifier.

data.name: Input
data.data: Prefer {{ `generateURL` || `generateUrl` }} as an identifier.

data.name: Input
Input
data.data:
Variables of __interface__ type have both a __static type__ and a __dynamic type__.

{{ True || False }}

data.name: Input
data.data:
All types in Go must be named.

{{False||True}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
Go __strings__ are immutable.

{{ True || False }}

data.name: Input
Input
Input
Input
data.data:
The declarations
```
x := make([]int, 50, 100)
```
and
```
x := new([100]int)[0:50]
```
produce the exact same result.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
It is possible for two arrays `a` and `b` to share storage. IE, a write to `a` affects a value in `b`.

{{False||True}}

data.name: Input
data.data:
It is possible for two __slices__ `a` and `b` to share storage. IE, a write to `a` effects a value stored in `b`.

{{True||False}}

data.name: Input
data.data: The zero-value of a slice is {{nil}}.

data.name: Input
Input
Input
data.data:
```
func main() {
	var s []int = nil
	fmt.Println(len(s))
}
```

This program {{ prints `0` || prints `nil` | panics }}.

data.name: Input
Input
